intro: Aeschynomene genistoides var. latifoliola, commonly known as broadleaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It is valued for its potential in forage and as a nitrogen-fixing cover crop. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various environmental conditions.
